main event: A ground visual observation of a single dark green oblong object that appeared on the northeast horizon, ascended slowly, moved along the northeast horizon at a slow speed, then descended and disappeared over the horizon.
interesting points: The object moved in a steady flight path with no rapid motions or 'hovering'.
The observation lasted for approximately 1 minute.
The report includes a diagram or illustration depicting the horizon, azimuth and elevation angles, as well as timestamps for the observed events.
The report mentions that the object was possibly a balloon.
